item.title: sshfs
item.description: How to mount remote machine’s directory on current host? This question originally came up when I wanted to use Kate to edit a configuration file on macOS. I normally ssh into macOS, cd to that directory, and then type kate <file> to try opening the file for editing. But huh? There’s no kate command. Oh right, because I’m in the macOS environment, of course there’s no kate! But this is a problem - am I restricted to only using vi to edit remote files?
